subject: Junit extensions and logging.

Hi, relative newbie to junit and logging here.

I am using this diasparsoft=
Toolkit and it has some nice features (this came
out of reading the junit r=
ecipies book
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/1932394230 - this is a =
really good
book). The logging in the test cases is easy if you inherit fro=
m their abc,
it's just info(...), warn(...), etc. and there is other good s=
tuff like
partially ordered tests and closure exceptions. But there may be =
other
things out there that I don't know about (fitness?)

The consensus se=
ems to be that jdk logging sucks big time (seems fine to me
though at first=
 blush)) and one should therefore use
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/log=
ging/ as it wraps log4j and jdk. 

I also have to deal with webmacro and it=
's logging.

My first priority is doing the architecture for testing in a g=
ood way, so
what do you guys think about this diasparsoft stuff? Have you f=
ound
something better or equal but different? (I am introducing junit into =
a
small .bomb that is not terribly agile (i.e. *no* tests) and has lot's of=

your typical many kloc servlets. So I can't get too carried away, but I
wo=
uld like to have some of the helper stuff in junit in whatever I can foist
=
upon them).

After that, does the commons logging seem best and has anyone =
used it with
webmacro? Or should I byte the bullet and say jdk all the way?=


Any pointers will be appreciated.

thanks 
---
ray tayek <http://tayek.co=

seeking telecommuting work=
.
